channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [BEAM-10252] AvroUtilsTest.supportsAnyAvroSchema NullPointerException
item.description:
AAvroUtilsTest.supportsAnyAvroSchema fails with a NullPointerException. Possible fix is to also check that the RowUtils.CapturingRowCases#processLogicalType method checks for a null in override.getOverrideValue().

From https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_Commit/11748/testReport/junit/org.apache.beam.sdk.schemas.utils/AvroUtilsTest/supportsAnyAvroSchema/

java.lang.AssertionError: Unexpected error in property supportsAnyAvroSchema with args [{"type":"record","name":"record_","namespace":"example","doc":"","fields":[{"name":"field_0","type":{"type":"map","values":{"type":"enum","name":"Status","doc":"","symbols":["OK","ERROR","WARNING"]}}},{"name":"field_1","type":["null",{"type":"enum","name":"Fruit","doc":"","symbols":["banana","apple","pear"]}]}]}] and seeds [6320879388626232139]

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This issue is P2 but has been unassigned without any comment for 60 days so it has been labeled "stale-P2". If this issue is still affecting you, we care! Please comment and remove the label. Otherwise, in 14 days the issue will be moved to P3.

Please see https://beam.apache.org/contribute/jira-priorities/ for a detailed explanation of what these priorities mean.
This issue was marked "stale-P2" and has not received a public comment in 14 days. It is now automatically moved to P3. If you are still affected by it, you can comment and move it back to P2.

Hello! Due to a bug in our Jira configuration, this issue had status:Resolved but resolution:Unresolved.

I am bulk editing these issues to have resolution:Fixed

If a different resolution is appropriate, please change it. To do this, click the "Resolve" button (you can do this even for closed issues) and set the Resolution field to the right value.
